We use a JUnit-based framework for system and integration testing.  Mock ob=
jects don't give you an assertion API or test drivers and reporting mechani=
sms.  Those are the things JUnit provides, no matter whether you use Cactus=
, J2EEUnit, our homegrown framework, etc.  Mock Objects are a complement to=
 our framework, but not a foundation.

I was just trying to respond to the =
suggestion that Cactus is a silver bullet for J2EE app server testing -- i.=
e., a team building a J2EE app server from scratch, not a team building app=
lications to run on a J2EE app server.

Scott
